DOC.brief_title: Diet Plasma Cholesterol - Secular Trend Analysis
DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : Mortality coronary heart disease decline 40 percent since late 1960s . Possible explanation decline include observed trend risk factor change rate hypertension , dyslipidemia , glucose intolerance ; lifestyle change improvement diet decrease level cigarette smoking ; good detection treatment heart disease . The specific effect risk factor , lifestyle , detection treatment change decline population rate coronary heart disease morbidity mortality unknown 1990 . Secular trend analyse need elucidate relative contribution factor , particularly dietary variable , population rate coronary heart disease . DESIGN NARRATIVE : Multiple regression use assess effect dietary variable change serum cholesterol 1957-1960 1966-1969 sample 200 men repeat measurement exist Framingham cohort . Analysis covariance use assess influence dietary intake difference serum cholesterol level independent sample men study 1957-1960 1966-1969 Framingham cohort , independent sample woman study 1957-1960 1984-1988 Framingham cohort Offspring cohort , independent sample men study 1966-1969 1984-1988 Framingham cohort Offspring cohort respectively . The study completion date list record obtain `` End Date '' enter Protocol Registration Results System ( PRS ) record .
